application.name: cnetcheck
application.brief: Checks for validity of a Control Net file.
application.description:
Checks for the validity of a Control Net file given a cube list. Its primary function is to check and find islands of the Control Net. These islands are then written to seperate files, which lists the cubes and their corresponding serial number. If a serial number's cube is not listed in the input list, than that cube will NOT be listed within the appropriate island file. If an island file is missing altogether, it is due to the fact that all of that islands cubes were not listed in the input list.
cnetcheck should be ran from the directory you wish for the output files to be written to.

parameter.name: FROMLIST
parameter.brief: List of ISIS3 input cubes in the Control Network
parameter.description: A text file containing one column of ISIS3 cube file names. Every file used in the match point file should be represented in this list.

parameter.name: CNET
parameter.description: Use this parameter to specify the control network file containing the information to be validated

parameter.name: DELIMIT
parameter.brief: The character to be inserted between file entries
parameter.description: This option will determine which character will be used to separate file entries, with the default option as a tab. The other options are comma, to separate with a single space, or "OTHER," which allows the user to input whatever they wish as the delimiter character.

option.description: This option will cause the file entries to be separated by tabs.
This option will cause the file entries to be separated by commas.
This option will cause the file entries to be separated by single space when output.

This option allows the user to determine what character is used to separate entries. When this option is selected, the CUSTOM parameter is used to determine what will be used. Whatever string the user enters will be used in between the entries.

parameter.name: CUSTOM
parameter.description: This parameter is only used if the user has selected "OTHER" as a delimiter. The user then enters something into this parameter to use as a delimiter.

parameter.name: PREFIX
parameter.description: The result of the validity check is placed in output files with the given prefix.

parameter.name: IGNORE
parameter.brief: Ignores ignored Control Points when checking the Control Net.
parameter.description: When true, all ignored Control Points and all ignored Control Measures provided by the Control Net will be discarded during calculations.

parameter.name: NOCONTROL
parameter.brief: Check for Cubes in the FROMLIST which are not in the Control Net.
parameter.description: When true, a file named [PREFIX]NoMatch.txt will be created, which will list all of the cubes, and their corresponding Serial Number which do not exist within the provided Control Net. If there are no such cubes, then no file is created.

parameter.name: NOCUBE
parameter.brief: Checks for cubes in the Control Net that are not listed in the FROMLIST.
parameter.description: When true, a file named [PREFIX]NoCube.txt will be created, which will list all of the Serial Numbers in the given Control Net which do not have a corresponding Cube in the proveded List. If there are no such Serial Numbers, then no file is created.

parameter.name: SINGLEMEASURE
parameter.brief: Check for Control Points which contain a single Control Measure.
parameter.description: When true, a file named [PREFIX]SinglePointCubes.txt will be created, which will list all of the Cubes which exist as a single Control Measure in any Control Point within the provided Control Net. If there are no such single Control Measures, then no file is created.

parameter.name: DUPLICATE
parameter.brief: Check for Control Points which contain the same cube in more than one Control Measure.
parameter.description: When true, a file named [PREFIX]DuplicateMeasures.txt will be created, which will list all of the cubes which exist in more than one Control Measure in a single Control Point within the provided Control Net. If there are no such duplicate Control Measures, then no file is created.

parameter.name: SINGLECUBE
parameter.brief: Check for Cubes which have only a single Control Measure.
parameter.description: When true, a file named [PREFIX]SingleCubes.txt will be created, which will list all of the Cubes which exist in only a single Control Measure within the entire Control Net. If there are no such single Cubes, then no file is created.

parameter.name: NOLATLON
parameter.brief: Check for measures for which latitudes and longitudes cannot be computed for.
parameter.description:
When true, a file named [PREFIX]NoLatLon.txt will be created, which will list all of the serial numbers which are within the given Control Net and listed in the input list which cannot compute a latitude and longitude. These serial numbers will be followed by the Control Point IDs in which they could not compute their latitudes and longitudes. If there are no such serial numbers, then no file is created.
Only cubes in both the FROMLIST and CNET are checked.
